newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-W. Australia in new processing era - Governor.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-W. Australia in new processing era - Governor.

text.p: Western Australia was entering into a new phase of downstream processing and value-added industries, the state's Governor Major-General Michael Jeffery, said on Thursday.

Officially opening the first session of the state's 35th parliament, Jeffery said agreements under negotiation, which would need parliamentary ratification, included the Kingstream Resources NL -An Feng Steel Co Ltd midwest integrated steel project near Geraldton with a possible new port at Oakajee at a projected overall cost of A$2.4 billion.
A uranium mining and processing project by the RTZ Corp Plc-CRA Ltd group at Kintyre in the Pilbara area was also under negotiations, he said.
Another key objective was be the setting up of a petrochemical project in the same region, he said.
German interest has been expressed in the petrochemical which is at early stages of planning.
The government has said it intends calling for expressions of interest later this year.
They also included Australian United Steel Industry Ltd's A$1.5 billion direct reduced iron plant near Wickham in the Pilbara, he said.
A A$1.8 billion iron ore enrichment plant by private group Mineralergy in the Fortescue area and a A$750 million Mt Gibson iron ore project were also the subject of negotiation, he said.
The projects would bring added value with almost 9,000 new jobs during the construction phase and almost 2,000 permanent jobs when production begins. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
